results.title: Give us a go
results.creator_credit: Diane Charleson and Materials Production, Education Dept for Equal Opportunity Board
results.brief_description: An explanation of the functions of the Equal Opportunity Board as it relates to the disabled. Various examples of discrimination are shown together with re-enactments showing conciliation and Board hearings.

results.title: Ghost town
results.brief_description: Uses ultra high contrast photography to convey the derelict nature of buildings and surroundings of the abandoned Overland Telegraph Station at Peake Creek, South Australia. No narration.

results.title: Getting down to earth
results.creator_credit: Richard Reinhardt, William Bronson, Denver Sutton and Wine Advisory Board
results.brief_description: The goddess Daphne decends to California (with backup help from Bacchus) to help restaurant staff promote and sell more wine with meals. Emphasizes effective presentation of wines and the virtues of California wines.

results.title: Germination and growth of a plant
results.brief_description:
Use of time-lapse photography showing the growth of a lupin plant. Shows the root growth below the ground, how the flower is pollinated by the bees and the internal germination is carried out - the production of the seed pod and finally the dispersal of the seeds.
Title and credits missing from film.

results.title: George Melies cinema magician
results.creator_credit: Luciano Martinengo, Patrick Montgomery and Blackhawk Films
results.brief_description: Cinema’s first genius, Georges Melies, was a professional magician who quickly realised that the camera offered the best illusion machine in the world. Renowned for his trick films, he was actually the first to tell complete stories on film and the first to use the camera effects considered standard today

results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.brief_description: Some of the scenic beauty of Japan - in nature and in the highly cultivated and famous gardens in Tokyo and Kyoto; a variety of gardens which have been planned and cultivated to please both the mind and the eye, including those using sand and stone to represent natural landscapes and which have symbolic signifance. A short sequence shows the traditional tea ceremony. A revised version of Title Codes 004193 and 004194.

results.title: Gallipoli: a virtual tour (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description: A highly visual interactive document on the First World War Gallipoli campaign. Containing hundreds of images, documents, music and various footage from 1915 makes this virtual tour ideal for schools. This CD-ROM is broken up into various historical aspects and is set up to play on both PC and Mac computers - all you need is a web browser such as Internet Explorer or Netscape. For PC users, Internet Explorer 5 can be installed from the CD.

results.title: Gala presentation and crowning of Miss Australia 1970
results.brief_description: A record of the Miss Australia Charity Quest of 1970 held in Adelaide. The state finalists are presented and interviewed before the crowning of Rhonda Ifland from NSW assisted by Miss Australia 1969, Susan McCellard. Hosted by Maggie Tabberer and Geoff McComas. Guests include: South Australian premier Steel Hall; and Bernard Dowd representing Hickory, the event sponsors. Hickory commercials are interspersed throughout the film.
